title: Bookmark importing from Chrome. Why is FF crashing on import?
content:
If it didn't crash, would bookmark data be retrievable - because I certainly are unable to. I've been trying for months from my regular desktop. Google's clearly strong-arming for market dominance by dragging their feet on this broken bookmark export.

What I've found works is logging in from another computer, syncing chrome acc and there I can export complete bookmark list. However, now I'm being restricted from logging into Chrome accounts with: error 400. Despite owning a pixel which is my 2FA!! Suddenly neither 2FA nor 3FA is adequate to fix error: 400 lmao

I think we need a plan to put public pressure on Google to allow individuals to access their curated bookmark data. That would require a Change.org and advertising money.

...thoughts?
creator: perusingschmuck

title: Firefox me está jodiendo la vida
content:
De repente Firefox ha comenzado a poner fondo azul a todo lo que puede. Supongo que tras alguna actualización o modificación, me ha abierto alguna ventana de forma inesperada mientras yo quería hacer otra cosa, y a lo mejor he hecho algún clic en algún sitio, que no sé yo. A saber.

A partir de ese momento todo ha ido a peor. He buscado cómo quitar el fondo azul y he descubierto los temas, pero eso no debe tener nada que ver, porque no se soluciona.

Así que he restaurado Firefox... y ¡¡¡¡Me ha perdido todas las contraseñas!!!!

Llevo años usando este programa, pero esto es un putadón inmenso basado en mi confianza en el producto. Producto que ahora me ha jodido porque no puedo acceder a mis sitios... o va a suponer tener que volver a restaurar las muchas contraseñas que tengo en multitud de sitios.

Maldigo a quien haya hecho posible que me pase esto.

Necesito ayuda, si es posible, para arreglar este desastre.
creator: amulefutmondo

title: Change in the Bookmarks Library keyboard shortcut
content:
With the recent release of Firefox 84.0, I noticed that the shortcut for the Bookmarks Library was changed from Ctrl+Shift+B to Ctrl+Shift+O. I use bookmarks extensively, but most of that is centered around the Library pane. I rarely, if ever, use the Bookmarks Toolbar.

Is there an option to go back to the old shortcut?

title: Firefox 84.0 crashes when trying to install electronic ID from card reader
content: Since the update of Firefox 84.0 I've been unable to use my card reader with a PKCS11 card to login into sites requesting an electronic ID identification. I'm on MacOS 10.15.7 with a Bit4id card reader. The problem is that when I try install the certificate into Firefox in Preferences -> Privacy and Security -> Certificates - Security Devices, Firefox freezes and I must force the closing. At restart, Firefox freezes again and I must restart it using the refresh option, that is I have to cancel all the personalizations and application of add-ons. The dynamic library that Firefox fails to load is libbit4xpki.dylib. The card reader and the card itself are working fine and I can use them with no problem in other browsers. Is anyone having this issue since the update? Any solution??? Thanks everybody! Nick
creator: nicola.pellicciotti

title: La fonction "ouvrir dans un nouvel onglet" qui ne fonctionne plus avec la nouvelle version de Firefox
content: Bonjour, Depuis le chargement de la dernière version de Firefox, certaines fonctions ont disparues. Par exemple, le site <www.F1LVT.com> est composé de quelques pages d'accueil qui donnent accès à des liens correspondant à des articles en pdf. Quand on clique sur le lien, avec la version précédente de Firefox ou avec un autre navigateur, l'article est affiché sur une nouvel onglet. Avec la dernière version de Firefox, ça ne fonctionne plus, le navigateur n'affiche pas un nouvel onglet et l'article en pdf est directement enregistré dans le PC sans avoir été ouvert dans Firefox. C'est assez désagréable. Au lieu de visualiser les liens, il faut aller rechercher dans les téléchargements et les ouvrir ... C'est la fonction "ouvrir dans un nouvel onglet" qui ne fonctionne plus avec la nouvelle version de Firefox. Cordialement Jean-Paul F1LVT@yahoo.fr
creator: F1LVT

title: Firefox no responde
content: Hace unos dias que Mozilla se congela y no responde por unos segundos. Empezo a pasar despues de que elimine adobe flash player, cuando paso de una pestaña a otra (en las paginas donde activaba flash) se pone lento o no responde. Si fueran muchas pestañas lo entenderia pero con 3 pestañas ya se congela. Ya intente restablecerlo, eliminarlo y reinstalarlo, e incluso formtie la pc ayer actualize todo los drivers y sigue pasando. No quiero volver a instalar flash ademas que se supone que firefox deberia funcionar bien sin el.
creator: palacios_m

title: Menu bar covers the tabs in mac fullscreen mode.
content: While using Firefox on Mac in fullscreen mode, trying to select a different tab by moving the pointer to the topmost position is a really annoying process. 90% of the times, I get the menu bar (which is hidden in the full screen mode, which is fine) jumping down and covering the tabs. To select the tabs without the menu bar interfering, I need to be extra careful while using the pointer! I find this annoying. I went back to Chrome to see how it is managed. Chrome actually resizes the window and takes the tab one position down, when the menu bar pops out, in the full screen mode. Not sure if it is the best workaround, but at least it works, and is much better than what Firefox does. Any setting to overcome this?
creator: vjrahul

title: Bug report: An error occurred while printing
content:
Note: In this problem, Safe Mode brings no Joy.

=== First print attempt File > Print Preview provokes this notice: "Print Preview Error" "An error occurred while printing"

Behind the error notice is this dialog: "Print Preview" "Title: Troubleshoot Firefox issues using Safe Mode | Firefox Help" "Progress: Preparing..." [_Cancel_]

"Preparing..." never goes away.

=== Thereafter File > Print Preview doesn't work at all (no response). File > Print provokes the error notice above.

This problem has often occurred. For some reason I can't rationalize, I think Firefox is attempting to print at the same time that it's preparing the print preview (or maybe I just think that because the notice says "...while printing".

Printing (and Print Preview) in the Palemoon browser works every time.

FF version 84.0 (64-bit) running in Linux Mint 18.3 running as a VBox Guest with a Win10 Host. The print target directory is in a virtual USB drive plugged into the VM (in both the FF and the Palemoon cases).
creator: markfilipak

title: firefox TABS, not the entire Firefox crash in the latest version
content:
Now in version 84,0 (64-bit) version tabs crash very often. Never before.

Just now I had been browsing on several tabs and watching Netflix on another screen. I checked in Task Manager (screenshot attached). Which showed 83% memory usage - but by arranging all running programmes this could not be correct as I have 32Gb RAM. Speccy report attached. I closed Firefox. No change in either Task Manager or Speccy on memory usage. Then I ran System Mechanic Pro which cleared a lot of junk internet files. And then checked Task Manager and Speccy again: 9% memory usage. This sounds about right.

My amateur assumption is that this version of Firefox does not clear closed tabs etc from the RAM memory - which leads to it becoming clogged.

Pros should know. And be able to solve this nuisance.

Thanks for help!
creator: lauri2

title: Don't want Sync
content:
Suddenly, a yellow icon with an explanation point in it has appeared over thee horizontal bars in the upper right of my tool bar section. When I click on it a warning reads "Reconnect to Firefox Account." I never knew I was not connected and since I'm able to write this, right here in a Firefox support group page with my account, I have a feeling I may still be conmected to my Firefox account. When I click on that warning icon I'm led to believe I should do something with this thing called Sync. I have to guess this is a Firefox software corruption or someone has hacked into Firefox and this is a phishing tool or malware.

How do I get rid of the yellow icon and the Sync stuff?

Does anyone know a telephone number or email address for Mozilla ?
creator: lee37

title: I am having multiple issues with Firefox.
content:
Issue #1 I have the automatic updates turned off, but Firefox occasionally updates anyway. How can I prevent this from happening?

Issue#2 This is somewhat related to issue #1. I turned off the automatic updates specifically because I did not want Quantum, but Firefox updated automatically, despite the automatic updates being turned off.. I have an older system, and it cannot handle running five processes for Firefox at one time. As a result, my system becomes increasingly slower as time goes by. As running multiple serves absolutely no discernible purpose, is there any way to prevent Firefox from running multiple processes?

Issue #3 Firefox recently updated automatically (again) without my permission, and since the most recent update, the pop up blocker is not working properly, specifically with Yahoo. It is blocking images, and windows that I bring up, but is not blocking what it is supposed to block, and will not let me add an exception for Yahoo. How can I fix this?

I am a Computer Science major, and have been using Firefox since it came out, but I am going to make a change if I can't fix these issues. Firefox is becoming more of a hassle than it is worth.
creator: jesterr

title: Does Firefox support .mp4 video?
content:
On page https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/html5-audio-and-video-firefox?redirectslug=viewing-html5-audio-and-video&redirectlocale=en-US

I find "AAC and H.264/MPEG-4 AVC are patented audio/video compression formats. They can be viewed in Firefox using built-in OS libraries (so neither Mozilla nor you need to pay a fee) if embedded in the MP4 container format (.mp4, .m4a, .m4p, .m4b, .m4r, .m4v file types)."

But when I create an HTML page with the following HTML5 code: 

<!DOCTYPE html> <html> <body> </body> This is a test of video. <video src="C:/MyVideoFile.mp4" controls> </video> </html>

I get the error "No video with supported format and MIME type found". Does Firefox in fact support .mp4 video? If so, what changes do I need to make in the HTML?

title: etsy.com will not load for the last two days. only i firefox.
content:
firefox won't load any pages of etsy.com for approximately the last two days.

although the site's logo appears on the browser tab, the browser window itself is a blank white page, no error message, no spinning wheel, and the full webpage address showing in the address bar.

help.etsy.com loads fine, although in reality, that directs to a zendesk domain.

etsy.com loads fine on other browsers and isn't showing outages on down detector, etc.

i have cleared the cache, cookies, etc., closed and reopened the browser, made sure i'm using the latest version, ran a malware scan, made sure there are no permissions, rules, add ons, apps, or other things that are interfering with the site loading.

i have not changed any of my firefox settings in the last year, besides automatic updates. antivirus also up to date and i don't appear to have any malware.

any ideas?

(also providing this info to etsy.com, in case the issue is 100% on their end.)

thanks in advance for any insights.
creator: kmuldoon

title: Accessing Telstra web mail using Firefox
content:
When I try to access my web mail from within My Telstra account all I get is three pulsating dots. I can access my web mail from inside My Telstra account when I use Edge. This has happened to me on two occasions in the past in 2017 and 2019. The 2019 was solved by re installing a fresh download of Firefox, This cure does not work this time. Searching for Telstra.com using Bing shows this result:-

"Login - My Account - Telstra www.my.telstra.com.au/myaccount/home

The version of the browser you are using looks outdated or not supported; this means that Telstra My Account may not display correctly and some features may be unavailable to you."

I am using the latest up to date Firefox. Can any one confirm and/or correct The result above ??
